channel.title: Client cache help!
channel.description: I recently downloaded a new server, with a new client of course. When i first ran the client, the cache downloaded perfectly. I logged on and everything was great. A couple of day's later i accidentally deleted the cache when cleaning my computer. I re-ran the client to try to download the cache, and it started to download fine. It said unpacking cache and then disappeared but the client stayed on loading. Can anyone help me?

item.title: Client cache help!
item.dc:creator: @pure_x_k0er pure x k0er
item.description:
@pure_x_k0er wrote:

The only file related to cache downloader is the cachedownloadergui.java
There isn’t a link in there

Read full topic

item.title: Client cache help!
item.dc:creator: @sex-scape_owner sex-scape owner
item.description:
@sex-scape_owner wrote:

hmm search the client folder and look for the file CacheDownloader.java open it and copy the link from that to web browser download that file and extract to c:

Read full topic

item.title: Client cache help!
item.dc:creator: @pure_x_k0er pure x k0er
item.description:
@pure_x_k0er wrote:

Ok here is a video to give you a better understanding of what is happening.

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=garfcUYeEDc[/youtube]

item.title: Client cache help!
item.dc:creator: @xmonster xmonster
item.description:
@xmonster wrote:

then just extract the cache ?

Read full topic

item.title: Client cache help!
item.dc:creator: @pure_x_k0er pure x k0er
item.description:
@pure_x_k0er wrote:

Hmm, the cache is a auto extract. When i run the client, it automatically starts extracting the cache. When it say’s, "Unpacking cache, it takes a few seconds and then disapears. The client then flashes once, and then stays at loading.

Read full topic

item.title: Client cache help!
item.dc:creator: @xmonster xmonster
item.description:
@xmonster wrote:

you have to extract the cache to :c/ and then it will run

Read full topic
